title: [BUG] SKPictureRecorder Canvas / Dispose Not Thread Safe?

comments.author: mlptownsend
comments.body:
Updating this with a new note. I managed to make this crash under some extreme load test conditions in an ASP.NET Core application with a lock in place. It just takes a long time and a lot of threads hammering on it to trigger it. I wound up forking the SVG library and creating a new method that just draws directly to SKBitmap without using SKPictureRecorder, but it would be a lot more helpful if the underlying unmanaged memory problem could be investigated. I saw something similar happening with SKSurface as well and had to abandon using them in lieu of only drawing with SKBitmap and SKCanvas.

Here's an example crash dump from the application:

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Could you have a look at the current rc: https://www.nuget.org/packages/SkiaSharp/1.68.1-rc.153

There was a large chunk of changes that fixed a whole bunch of issues - most of them relating to mutithreaded environment.
